content:
• Tuesday, July 26, 2011
  • EA

    More on Electronic Arts' (ERTS) FQ1: Company forecasts FQ2 revenue of $925M-$975M, above $902M...

    More on Electronic Arts' (ERTS) FQ1: Company forecasts FQ2 revenue of $925M-$975M, above $902M consensus. Slightly raises FQ2 non-GAAP EPS guidance range. Raises FY2012 revenue guidance to $3.9B-$4.1B, from $3.8B-$4.025B. Forecasts FY2012 EPS of $0.70-$0.90, compared with $0.84 consensus. ERTS now -1.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $358.6M (-2.1% Y/Y)...

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $358.6M (-2.1% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW): Q2 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $949.8M (+15.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW): Q2 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $949.8M (+15.9% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • TAL

    Chinese after-school tutoring services provider TAL Education Group (XRS) soared 22.1% today...

    Chinese after-school tutoring services provider TAL Education Group (XRS) soared 22.1% today after posting FQ1 2012 non-GAAP EPS of $0.09, ahead of the $0.04 consensus. Revenue rose 62.7% Y/Y to $33.2M. The company is guiding for FQ2 revenue growth of 42-47%, and FY2012 revenue growth of 40-45%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • JNPR

    More on Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) Q2: The company says Q2 performance was impacted by "a number of...

    More on Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) Q2: The company says Q2 performance was impacted by "a number of factors," including macroeconomic issues. Juniper's Service Layer Technologies security hardware business fell 8% Y/Y, compared with 5% growth in Q1. Asia-Pacific revenue growth decelerated to 9% Y/Y, compared with 37% in Q1. JNPR -12.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • LVS

    More on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q2 returns to a profit on strong growth from its Macau and...

    More on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q2 returns to a profit on strong growth from its Macau and Singapore properties, and a slight rebound in Las Vegas. Revenue soars 47% to a record $2.35B. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • PPDI

    Pharmaceutical Product Development (NASDAQ:PPDI): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of...

    Pharmaceutical Product Development (NASDAQ:PPDI): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $407.7M (+10.2% Y/Y). Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CHRW

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide (NASDAQ:CHRW): EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $2.71B (+10 Y/Y)...

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide (NASDAQ:CHRW): EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $2.71B (+10 Y/Y) beats by $0.01B. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • MLI

    Mueller Industries (NYSE:MLI), a maker of copper and aluminum products for the construction...

    Mueller Industries (NYSE:MLI), a maker of copper and aluminum products for the construction market, fell 10% today after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.59, below the $0.74. Revenue came in at $652.9M (+20.8% Y/Y), above the $614.2M consensus. Like many other companies, Mueller appears to have been hit hard by rising commodity costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $489M (+3%...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $489M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q2 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $287.5M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q2 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $287.5M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by $5.8M. Sees FY'11 EPS at $1.06. Shares -8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.12B (+15%...

    Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.12B (+15% Y/Y) misses by $30M. Guides for Q3 revenue of $1.07B-$1.12B, below $1.22B consensus. Guides for non-GAAP EPS of $0.26-$0.30, below $0.38 consensus. Shares -10.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (ERTS): FQ1 EPS of -$0.37 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $524M (-2.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Electronic Arts (ERTS): FQ1 EPS of -$0.37 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $524M (-2.8% Y/Y) beats by $11.5M. Raises full-year digital revenue guidance to $1.1-1.15B. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AMZN

    More on Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) earnings: Worldwide media sales up 27% to $3.66B; Worldwide...

    More on Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) earnings: Worldwide media sales up 27% to $3.66B; Worldwide Electronics sales up 69% to $5.89B. Kindle sales growth sped up sequentially and the Kindle store has more than 950K books. North America and international sales both up 51% Y/Y. Shares now up 5.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $2.35B (+47.1% Y/Y) beats...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q2 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $2.35B (+47.1% Y/Y) beats by $131M. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • DWA

    Dreamworks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q2 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $218.3M (+38.1%...

    Dreamworks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q2 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $218.3M (+38.1% Y/Y) beats by $27.5M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $9.9B (up 51% Y/Y)...

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $9.9B (up 51% Y/Y) beats by $0.5B. Expects sharply lower operating income in Q3 of $20M to $170M, but revenues of $10.3B-$11.1B vs. $10.35B. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 5 Comments
  • CSL

    Construction materials firm Carlisle (NYSE:CSL) is down 9.2% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS...

    Construction materials firm Carlisle (NYSE:CSL) is down 9.2% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $870.8M and $0.87 - the former figure beat consensus by $40.5M, but the latter missed by $0.04. The company is blaming margin weakness on higher raw material costs and "production inefficiencies" related to the startup of a tire facility. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • PCXCQ

    More on Patriot Coal (PCX -13.7%): the stock continues to trade lower into the close, after...

    More on Patriot Coal (PCX -13.7%): the stock continues to trade lower into the close, after posting a Q2 loss where analysts were expecting a gain. "A number of factors impacted our costs this quarter," CEO Mark Schroeder says, "including new mines coming on-line, higher sales-related costs, and the idling of the Panther longwall for about two weeks."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTG

    Healthcare IT consulting firm CTG (CTGX) is down 15.5% after reporting Q2 results yesterday....

    Healthcare IT consulting firm CTG (CTGX) is down 15.5% after reporting Q2 results yesterday. While the company's Q2 revenue beat the consensus and EPS was in line, CTG's 2011 EPS guidance of $0.67-$0.73 fell short of the $0.74 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • BIDU

    Jeffries is reiterating a Buy rating and $200 PT for Baidu (BIDU +5.1%) following its Q2...

    Jeffries is reiterating a Buy rating and $200 PT for Baidu (BIDU +5.1%) following its Q2 results, arguing the company's Phoenix Nest technology is driving paid click growth. However, Morgan Stanley is reiterating an Equal Weight rating, citing concerns about rising bandwidth costs and expenses related to new ventures. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • VDSI-OLD

    Vasco Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -15.5%) continues lower after its Q2 earnings report...

    Vasco Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -15.5%) continues lower after its Q2 earnings report showed weaker gross margins on increased competition and lower-than-average selling prices. As a result, FY11 margins are now forecast to come in below last years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC -10%) is lower today, after statements in its Gulf LNG project update hint that...

    InterOil (IOC -10%) is lower today, after statements in its Gulf LNG project update hint that Papua New Guinea's Oil Minister may be raising questions about the quality and safety of the company's technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • NFLX

    Following its Q2 revenue shortfall and soft Q3 guidance, Goldman is still confident Netflix...

    Following its Q2 revenue shortfall and soft Q3 guidance, Goldman is still confident Netflix (NFLX -6.5%) will be able to grow its average revenue per user in Q4, while Citi is positive on the prospect of declining postage costs. However, Morgan Stanley is concerned about Netflix's ongoing lack of U.S. social media integration and middling Canadian growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 3 Comments
  • UCTT

    Ultra Clean (UCTT -12%) is trading lower despite posting a 23% jump in Q2 earnings and topping...

    Ultra Clean (UCTT -12%) is trading lower despite posting a 23% jump in Q2 earnings and topping estimates yesterday after the close. Investors are focusing on the company's lowered Q3 forecast, attributed to a decline in demand from its key semiconductor equipment customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +3.6%), whose shares skyrocketed last week after the company put itself on...

    InterDigital (IDCC +3.6%), whose shares skyrocketed last week after the company put itself on the block and drew attention from Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) and Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), has filed a complaint with the ITC against Nokia (NYSE:NOK), Huawei, and ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOY), and is seeking a ban on the import of mobile devices made by the three companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is up 9.7% as Citi's Kevin J. Dennean upgrades the firm to Buy from Hold....

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) is up 9.7% as Citi's Kevin J. Dennean upgrades the firm to Buy from Hold. Dennean believes expectations for the company have been "fully reset" following a round of disappointing results, and thinks new products will give the company a boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • PCAR

    More on Paccar (PCAR -11.2%): Q2 earnings surged as the heavy-duty truck maker posted stronger...

    More on Paccar (PCAR -11.2%): Q2 earnings surged as the heavy-duty truck maker posted stronger sales, but earnings still fell short of estimates as parts shortages held down production volumes and drove up costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -16.2%) is the S&P's worst performer at this hour, as Q2 earnings and...

    AK Steel (AKS -16.2%) is the S&P's worst performer at this hour, as Q2 earnings and revenue fall short of estimates. Management identifies the culprit as rising iron ore prices, calling the quarter "solid" otherwise. Shares of U.S. Steel (X -8.6%), which issued its own lackluster Q2 report, Nucor (NUE -2.8%) and Steel Dynamics (STLD -2.8%) also are lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) is now down 9.6% after announcing disappointing Q2 results and Q3...

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) is now down 9.6% after announcing disappointing Q2 results and Q3 guidance - at least partly the result of troubles at top customer Nokia (NYSE:NOK). BNP Paribas and and Banca Akros are respectively downgrading the company to Underperform and Reduce, with the former worried about STMicro's plunging gross margin.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • REDF

    Rediff.com (REDF -16.1%) tanks after earlier reporting a Q1 loss on weaker-than-expected sales....

    Rediff.com (REDF -16.1%) tanks after earlier reporting a Q1 loss on weaker-than-expected sales. Top-line advertising revenues from financial services, insurance and telecom customers declined as the floundering economy forced cutbacks in spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • OKSB

    Southwest Bancorp (OKSB -36%) gets clobbered after reporting a loss for Q2, as non-performing...

    Southwest Bancorp (OKSB -36%) gets clobbered after reporting a loss for Q2, as non-performing commercial real estate loans skyrocketed to 8.66%. "We continue to focus on the resolution of problem assets," says CEO Rick Green, and "levels of nonperforming loans and potential problem loans are likely to fluctuate up and down as the process continues."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVGO

    What a difference a quarter makes, as Broadcom's (BRCM +9.6%) sour April outlook is now...

    What a difference a quarter makes, as Broadcom's (BRCM +9.6%) sour April outlook is now transformed into seeing "strong demand for our communications solutions, reinforcing that innovation is driving customer demand." Shares lift semiconductor stocks (SOXX +1.3%) and help keep Nasdaq's head above water as the only major index now in positive territory.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • WPP-OLD

    Wasau Paper (WPP-OLD +15%) is trading higher, largely due to short covering after Q2 earnings...

    Wasau Paper (WPP-OLD +15%) is trading higher, largely due to short covering after Q2 earnings marginally beat estimates. The stock's been a poor performer all year, down nearly 30%, and short interest had increased significantly ahead of its earnings report, with over 8 days needed to cover.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • SAP

    Business software giant SAP is up 6.9% after announcing its 2011 operating profit will be at the...

    Business software giant SAP is up 6.9% after announcing its 2011 operating profit will be at the high end of its guidance range of €4.45B-€4.65B. In addition, software and software-related services revenue growth is expected to be at the high end of its guidance range of 10-14%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • BXS

    Bancorp South (BXS +10.4%) soars after swinging to a Q2 profit on better-than-expected credit...

    Bancorp South (BXS +10.4%) soars after swinging to a Q2 profit on better-than-expected credit quality improvements, with more juice provided by analysts at Stephens who say the regional bank should now be considered a “legitimate takeout candidate.” While profitability likely will remain below peers near-term, Stephens says the takeout appeal offsets the discount.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM

  • Auto retailer Group 1 Automotive (GPI +13%%) jumps after reporting Q2 earnings topped estimates....

    Auto retailer Group 1 Automotive (GPI +13%%) jumps after reporting Q2 earnings topped estimates. The company's top line got a lift from higher margins on new vehicles, while its bottom line was helped by lower expenses for stocking dealerships.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • USO

    Crude oil is spiking higher, up nearly $3 in the past couple of hours and taking out $100/barrel...

    Crude oil is spiking higher, up nearly $3 in the past couple of hours and taking out $100/barrel again. USO +1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • ODP

    More on Office Depot (ODP +11.5%): despite widening Q2 losses, an uptick in sales for the first...

    More on Office Depot (ODP +11.5%): despite widening Q2 losses, an uptick in sales for the first time in 13 consecutive quarters gives investors reason to celebrate, or at least to cover their short positions. The stock is down over 36% this year, and still faces weak sales and sluggish growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • VLTR

    Volterra Semiconductor (VLTR +15.3%) pops after Q2 profits beat estimates. Revenue grew over...

    Volterra Semiconductor (VLTR +15.3%) pops after Q2 profits beat estimates. Revenue grew over 22%, as the company's integrated power technology gains traction in the notebook market. Piper Jaffray ups the stock to overweight, saying Volterra should benefit from the launch of Intel's Romley server platform in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • GE

    Rare earth miners are shooting higher after a paper from GE's Lighting division, which relies...

    Rare earth miners are shooting higher after a paper from GE's Lighting division, which relies heavily on rare earth minerals, states that "further price increases seem highly likely." GE also suggests stockpiling by dealers due to soaring prices is making a bad situation worse. MCP +5.3%. REE +4.9%. SHZ +7%. AVL +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • CMI

    More on Cummins (CMI +4.8%): Q2 profit more than doubled as the engine maker's top-line gets a...

    More on Cummins (CMI +4.8%): Q2 profit more than doubled as the engine maker's top-line gets a boost from strong growth in its international and off-road markets. The company has been a consistent performer, posting double-digit Y/Y revenue growth and beating estimates over five straight quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CNC

    Managed care provider Centene (CNC +8.1%) trades higher after posting better-than-expected Q2...

    Managed care provider Centene (CNC +8.1%) trades higher after posting better-than-expected Q2 earnings helped by lower medical costs. Bottom-line performance has been boosting the insurer's results for more than a year, as its customers continue to log fewer visits to the doctor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CORV

    Canadian drug developer Cardiome Pharma (CRME) surges 23.5% after announcing it has given...

    Canadian drug developer Cardiome Pharma (CRME) surges 23.5% after announcing it has given consent for the transfer of North American rights for the development and commercialization of its Vernakalant IV atrial fibrillation drug from Astellas (OTCPK:ALPMY) to Merck (NYSE:MRK). Cardiome releases earnings after the close today.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • WFT

    More on Weatherford (WFT +8%): Q2 easily tops estimates, but with two disappointing quarters...

    More on Weatherford (WFT +8%): Q2 easily tops estimates, but with two disappointing quarters behind it, expectations were low enough that it would have been difficult not to beat. The stock has underperformed for most of the year, and todays move may just bring the oil services company closer in-line with its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • SANM

    After taking a beating last quarter, Sanmina (SANM +17%) easily beats its lowered-bar...

    After taking a beating last quarter, Sanmina (SANM +17%) easily beats its lowered-bar expectations for FQ3. Business across the board was strong, with gross and operating margins both exceeding high-end expectations. The company also reafirms guidance for FQ4 in the range of $0.40 - $0.44.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • STEC

    Enterprise solid-state drive vendor STEC is down 6.3% after disclosing in an 8-K that the SEC is...

    Enterprise solid-state drive vendor STEC is down 6.3% after disclosing in an 8-K that the SEC is conducting a formal investigation regarding trading in the company's securities, and that its CEO and President are among company employees who have received subpoenas related to the investigation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MDT

    More on Covidien (COV +4.3%): FQ3 earnings jumped 47% as acquisitions and new products from its...

    More on Covidien (COV +4.3%): FQ3 earnings jumped 47% as acquisitions and new products from its medical devices unit continue to drive sales growth and offset anemic performance from its pharmaceuticals group.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS) is down 9.1% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $937M (-10% Y/Y) and...

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS) is down 9.1% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $937M (-10% Y/Y) and -$0.27, below the $951M and -$0.08 consensus. The shortfall is blamed on weak government orders and lower sales of ClearPath mainframes. The ClearPath business is mired in a long-term decline, as remaining mainframe devotees flock to IBM's System z platform. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (DRYS -4.5%) buys OceanFreight (OCNFD +78%) for $118M, as the cargo transporter looks...

    DryShips (DRYS -4.5%) buys OceanFreight (OCNFD +78%) for $118M, as the cargo transporter looks to consolidate its fragmented drybulk business and add newer vessels with long-term charters to its fleet. OceanFreight holders will get $11.25  a share in cash, plus 0.52326 share of Ocean Rig UDW, a drilling services firm owned by DryShips.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP +9.7%) jumps after announcing plans to sell its products on eBay (EBAY...

    American Apparel (APP +9.7%) jumps after announcing plans to sell its products on eBay (EBAY +0.3%) as part of an effort to expand into new markets and open new distribution channels.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • UPS

    More on UPS' Q2: Revenue beats consensus by $50M. Adjusted operating margin of 12.6% up 1.1%...

    More on UPS' Q2: Revenue beats consensus by $50M. Adjusted operating margin of 12.6% up 1.1% Y/Y. Average volume/day of 14.9M packages up 100K Y/Y. Domestic volume/day of 12.63M nearly unchanged. Guides for 2011 EPS of $4.15-$4.40, in line with $4.34 consensus, but concerned about "economic conditions" impacting performance. UPS -2.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • AKS

    More on AK Steel (AKS -5%): despite increased sales, the company misses Q2 estimates as raw...

    More on AK Steel (AKS -5%): despite increased sales, the company misses Q2 estimates as raw material prices cut heavy into margins. The company says profits will be further pressured in Q3 as steel prices are expected to decline about 1% over the period, while raw material costs will continue to rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) tries to put the best face on its recent decision to raise prices for DVD...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) tries to put the best face on its recent decision to raise prices for DVD subscribers who also stream videos, telling shareholders that nearly 75% of new subscribers signed up for the plan in Q2. Better love it or leave it: "We hate making our subscribers upset with us, but we feel like we provide a fantastic service..." NFLX -9.3% premarket. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LXK

    More on Lexmark (NYSE:LXK): Q2 profits were higher as the company resolves its recent...

    More on Lexmark (NYSE:LXK): Q2 profits were higher as the company resolves its recent supply-chain issues and shows progress in recent efforts to retool its business model. The company is switching its focus to enterprise customers instead of consumers, as the low-end laser printer market has become saturated with competition. Shares +9.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • SONE

    Premarket gainers: SONE +29%. APP +23%. RSH +19%. GRA +9%. SVU +8%. BRCM +9%. CIGX +8%. WFT +8%....

    Premarket gainers: SONE +29%. APP +23%. RSH +19%. GRA +9%. SVU +8%. BRCM +9%. CIGX +8%. WFT +8%. BIDU +6%. CMI +6%. COV +5%. RENN +4%. YOKU +3%. GSK +3%.
    Losers: LII -11%. VDSI-OLD -9%. EK -9%. STM -9%. NFLX -8%. FNDT -7%. WAT -7%. AKS -6%. QGEN -3%. NVDA -3%. MMM -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • KODK

    Kodak (EK) misses Q2 estimates despite a small increase in sales, as the cost of revamping its...

    Kodak (EK) misses Q2 estimates despite a small increase in sales, as the cost of revamping its commercial and consumer printing business weighs on results. Earnings in the film and photofinishing group fell 94%, as material costs hurt margins. Shares -7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $1.79B (+12.3% Y/Y). Shares...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $1.79B (+12.3% Y/Y). Shares -5.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • RSH

    More on Radioshack (NYSE:RSH): despite missing Q2 estimates on a 53% drop in sales, RadioShack...

    More on Radioshack (NYSE:RSH): despite missing Q2 estimates on a 53% drop in sales, RadioShack (RSH) is trading higher in the premarket session after the company announces it will begin offering Verizon (NYSE:VZ) products in September. Shares +17% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • ITW

    More on Illinois Tool Works' (NYSE:ITW) Q2: Revenue misses consensus by $65M. Guides for Q3 EPS...

    More on Illinois Tool Works' (NYSE:ITW) Q2: Revenue misses consensus by $65M. Guides for Q3 EPS of $0.95-$1.03, below $1.06 consensus. Guides for 2011 EPS of $3.72-$3.88 (exc. one-time tax benefit), below $3.92 consensus. Company long seen as barometer for industrial demand. ITW -3.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
